intro: Sacoglottis procera, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its thick, succulent stems that store water, allowing it to survive in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive hooded shape. The latex sap of Sacoglottis procera is milky and can be toxic if ingested.
